item.title: 'Prince of Persia: The Sands of Time Remake' won't be at E3
item.description: Ubisoft says the game is on track for a 2022 release date.

item.title: Blast Box lets musician stream performances that are only available for 24 hours
item.description: Blast Radio has launched a service where musicians can broadcast performances that disappear in 24 hours, and they can stream through an easy-to-use box.

item.title: General Motors offers OnStar Guardian to non-GM drivers
item.description: OnStar Guardian can now be used even if you drive cars from another brand.

item.title: AT&T is giving six months of Stadia Pro to 5G and fiber internet subscribers
item.description: AT&T is now offering six months of Stadia Pro to 5G and fiber internet subscribers, plus a discount on the hardware you need to play.

item.title: Adobe optimizes Illustrator, InDesign and Lightroom Classic for M1 Macs
item.description: Adobe says that the M1-native versions are significantly faster than their Intel equivalents.

item.title: Samsung's Galaxy Buds Pro fall to a new all-time low price at Woot
item.description: Samsung's premium Galaxy Buds Pro true wireless earbuds with active noise cancellation are now just $140 thanks to a new deal.

item.title: MoviePass settles with FTC over complaints that it blocked subscribers
item.description: MoviePass operators have agreed to settle with the FTC.

item.title: Fortnite's new season lets you fly UFOs and play as Superman
item.description: Fortnite has unveiled its 7th season of chapter 2 with the ability to play as Superman or Rick & Morty's Rich Sanchez and fly in a UFO

item.title: Apple's educational iOS coding tool lets users build and submit App Store apps
item.description: Apple is updating Swift Playgrounds to allow app developers to build and submit their software directly to the App Store from an iPad.

item.title: The Morning After: Apple's WWDC 2021
item.description: Today’s headlines: Apple announces iOS 15 at WWDC, with a focus on notifications and privacy, DOJ recovers 63.7 Bitcoins paid out in Colonial Pipeline ransomware attack and Apple's watchOS 8 adds new mindfulness exercises and tai chi.

item.title: Ubisoft's upcoming Rainbow Six game is now called 'Extraction'
item.description: Ubisoft has announced that Rainbow Six Quarantine will now officially be called Rainbow Six Extraction.

item.title: Amazon, Reddit, Twitter and Twitch impacted by huge network outage
item.description: A huge internet outage has affected large swaths of the internet this morning, including major sites like Amazon, Reddit, Twitter and Twitch.

item.title: The FBI operated an 'encrypted' chat app for organized criminals
item.description: The FBI secretly ran an encrypted chat app, known as Anom, as part of a global sting operation.

item.title: Ford's Maverick starts at less than $20k with a hybrid engine and built-in LTE
item.description: The first pickup truck to come standard with a hybrid powertrain is the Ford Maverick, and you can buy one for $21,490 later this year.

item.title: Apple Music Lossless is now available on supported devices
item.description: Lossless-quality streaming is now available on Apple Music, shortly after the streaming service flipped the switch on Dolby Atmos spatial audio.

item.title: Apple will not release its VPN-like 'private relay' feature in China
item.description: Apple's "privacy relay" feature won't be available in China.

item.title: What's on TV: 'Loki,' 'Ratchet & Clank' and 'FFVII: Advent Children'
item.description: Also new this week: 'Indiana Jones' in 4K, 'Game Builder Garage' and 'Lupin' part two.

item.title: Jaybird's Vista 2 earbuds offer ANC and better battery life for $200
item.description: Jaybird's Vista 2 earbuds are packed with upgrades, from ANC to improved battery life and a waterproof design.

item.title: Apple's 'Find My' network locates iOS 15 devices even if they're off or erased
item.description: iOS 15 is making Find My tracking more persistent -- now it will locate iPhones and iPads that have been turned off or erased.

item.title: Apple will still release security updates for iOS 14 after iOS 15 comes out
item.description: When iOS 15 is released, if you don't want to upgrade immediately then you can stay on iOS 14 and still receive security patches as they're released.

item.title: Graphene could allow hard drives to hold 10 times more data
item.description: Using graphene, everyone's favorite wonder material, they replaced the carbon-based overcoat (COC) on several hard drives.

item.title: DOJ recovers 63.7 Bitcoins paid out in Colonial Pipeline ransomware attack
item.description: The US Justice Department has recovered part of the ransom Colonial Pipeline paid last month to regain access to its computer systems after it was locked out of them by “apolitical” ransomware gang Darkside.

item.title: Everything Apple announced at its WWDC 2021 keynote
item.description: From iOS to macOS Monterey and privacy, here's everything Apple announced at WWDC.

item.title: macOS Monterey will drop support for older MacBook Pro and Air models
item.description: You may need to upgrade if you want the latest version of Apple's desktop operating system.

item.title: Apple's Testflight beta testing service is coming to macOS
item.description: Apple announced that its Testflight tool, which allows developers to share their apps with non-developer beta testers, is finally migrating to MacOS.
